body:
$!Limousines with up to 8 passengers seats don't require a licence for weddings and funerals.$!

Limousines must be run by a licensed operator unless they're being hired out without a driver. 

For small limousines - seating up to 8 passengers - you'll need a private hire vehicle (PHV) operator licence. This is different [inside London](private-hire-vehicle-operator-licence-inside-london “private-hire-vehicle-operator-licence-inside-london”) and [outside London](private-hire-vehicle-operator-licence-outside-london “PHV licensing outside London”).

For large limousines - seating 9 passengers or more - you'll need to get a public sector vehicle (PSV) operator licence. 

%Operators hiring out limousines and drivers separately to avoid licensing are breaking the law.%

##Vehicle standards##
Stretched limousines must have [Individual Vehicle Approval (IVA)](vehicle-type-approval/individual-vehicle-approval “Individual vehicle approval”) to be registered and licensed. For those built before 29 July 2011, a Certificate of Fitness (COIF) is accepted.

##Fines and penalties##

Your limousines can be destroyed or confiscated if you aren't licensed or your vehicles aren't properly insured. For other offences you can be prosecuted and fined.

$D[Download 'Guidance for operators of stretch limousines' (PDF, 287KB)](http://www.dft.gov.uk/vosa/repository/Guidance%20for%20Operators%20of%20Stretch%20Limousines.pdf "Guidance for operators of stretch limousines")$D

*[COIF]: Certificate of Fitness
*[DVLA]:Driver and Vehicle Licensing Agency
*[DVA]:Driver and Vehicle Agency
*[PSV]:Public Service Vehicle
*[PHV]:Public Hire Vehicle
*[IVA]: Individual Vehicle Approval
overview: Limousines must be run by a licensed operator unless they're being hired out without a driver - licensing, private hire vehicle, public service vehicle
title: Limousine licensing
